      void addOrUpdateGroup(Map<String,Object> params, ISirqulCallback<ConnectionGroupResponse> callback)
      Creates a new private group.

      Target API Endpoint: /consumer/connection/group

      Available parameters for this api SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
      the account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required) SirqulKeys.name
      the name of the group SirqulKeys.groupId
      the group id to update a group (don't pass anything in if you want to create a new group) SirqulKeys.assetId
      the asset to attach to the group SirqulKeys.connections
      list of connection IDs SirqulKeys.description
      the description of the group SirqulKeys.canViewProfileInfo
      determines whether the connections in the group can see the user's profile info SirqulKeys.canViewGameInfo
      determines whether the connections in the group can see the user's game info SirqulKeys.canViewFriendInfo
      determines whether the connections in the group can see the user's friends/connections SirqulKeys.location of type Location
      the location
      SirqulResponse subclass type:
      a ConnectionGroupResponse on valid response, or SirqulResponse with error message
      void addSubGroups(Map<String,Object> params, ISirqulCallback<ConnectionGroupResponse> callback)
      Add sub groups to a group.

      Target API Endpoint: /consumer/connection/group/addSubGroup

      Available parameters for this api SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
      the account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required, deviceId added automatically) SirqulKeys.groupId
      the parent group id SirqulKeys.subGroupIds
      list of group IDs to add to the parent group SirqulKeys.location of type Location
      the current location of the user
      SirqulResponse subclass type:
      ConnectionGroupResponse on a valid response, SirqulResponse on an invalid response

    • Method Detail

      • acceptConnection

        public void acceptConnection(Map<String,Object> params,
                    ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
        Accept a friend request and optionally sends a notification.

        Target API Endpoint: /consumer/friend/accept

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          the account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required)
        • SirqulKeys.friendAccountId
          the friend's account id
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          the application key. A unique id of the app. Maps to "gameType".
        • SirqulKeys.notifyFriend
          determines whether to send a notification to the afflicting party
        • SirqulKeys.notificationMessage
          optional message to send in a notification

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        ConnectionApiBase.acceptConnection

      • addOrUpdateConnection

        public void addOrUpdateConnection(Map<String,Object> params,
                         ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
        Creates or updates the connection of the user and another account. Allows a user to follow, block, mark as trusted, and/or add someone to a group.

        Target API Endpoint: /consumer/connection/add

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          the account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required, deviceId sent automatically).
        • SirqulKeys.connectionId
          the connection id for editing
        • SirqulKeys.connectionAccountId
          the connection account id (i.e. the account id of another user)
        • SirqulKeys.pendingId
          the pending id (usually for people who do not have a Sirqul account but are already friends via other third party apps)
        • SirqulKeys.groupId
          optional group id if the user wants to add this person into a group
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          the application key. Maps to "gameType".
        • SirqulKeys.isTrusted
          determines whether the user is trusting this account
        • SirqulKeys.isBlocked
          determines whether the user is blocking this account
        • SirqulKeys.isFollowing
          determines whether the user is following this account

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        ConnectionApiBase.addOrUpdateConnection

      • addOrUpdateGroup

        public void addOrUpdateGroup(Map<String,Object> params,
                    ISirqulCallback<ConnectionGroupResponse> callback)
        Creates a new private group.

        Target API Endpoint: /consumer/connection/group

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          the account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required)
        • SirqulKeys.name
          the name of the group
        • SirqulKeys.groupId
          the group id to update a group (don't pass anything in if you want to create a new group)
        • SirqulKeys.assetId
          the asset to attach to the group
        • SirqulKeys.connections
          list of connection IDs
        • SirqulKeys.description
          the description of the group
        • SirqulKeys.canViewProfileInfo
          determines whether the connections in the group can see the user's profile info
        • SirqulKeys.canViewGameInfo
          determines whether the connections in the group can see the user's game info
        • SirqulKeys.canViewFriendInfo
          determines whether the connections in the group can see the user's friends/connections
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          the location

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a ConnectionGroupResponse on valid response, or SirqulResponse with error message
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        ConnectionApiBase.addOrUpdateGroup

      • getConnections

        public void getConnections(Map<String,Object> params,
                  ISirqulCallback<ConnectionListResponse> callback)
        Gets the connections.

        Target API Endpoint: /consumer/connection/get

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          the account id (deviceId or accountId required)
        • SirqulKeys.connectionAccountId
          optional parameter to search on other account's connections
        • SirqulKeys.filters
          a comma separated list of Enums.ConnectionApiMap. (NOTE on FOLLOWER vs FOLLOWING: FOLLOWER will get me a list of followers, FOLLOWING will get me a list of people I am following)
        • SirqulKeys.keyword
          an optional keyword to search on, this parameter is ignored if empty
        • SirqulKeys.sortField
          sorts the response list by Enums.ConnectionApiMap
        • SirqulKeys.descending
          determines whether the sorted list is in descending or ascending order
        • SirqulKeys.start
          start index of the pagination
        • SirqulKeys.limit
          limit of the pagination
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          the current location of the user.

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a ConnectionListResponse on valid response, or SirqulResponse with error message
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        ConnectionApiBase.getConnections

      • getGroupDetails

        public void getGroupDetails(Map<String,Object> params,
                   ISirqulCallback<ConnectionGroupResponse> callback)
        Get detailed information about a group.

        Target API Endpoint: /consumer/connection/group/details/get

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          the account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required, deviceId added automatically)
        • SirqulKeys.groupId
          the group id
        • SirqulKeys.combineConnections
          Indicates whether to combine subgroup connections (up to 4 dimensions) for the return data. This does not affect sub group structure on server.
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          the current location of the user

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        ConnectionGroupResponse on a valid response, SirqulResponse on an invalid response
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.

        public void removeConnection(Map<String,Object> params,
                    ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)

      • removeConnectionFromGroup

        public void removeConnectionFromGroup(Map<String,Object> params,
                             ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
        Removes the connection from group.

        Target API Endpoint: /consumer/connection/group/removeConnection

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          the account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required)
        • SirqulKeys.connectionId
          the connection id
        • SirqulKeys.connectionAccountId
          the connection account id
        • SirqulKeys.pendingId
          the pending id
        • SirqulKeys.groupId
          the group id
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          the current location of the user

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        ConnectionApiBase.removeConnectionFromGroup

      • removeSubGroups

        public void removeSubGroups(Map<String,Object> params,
                   ISirqulCallback<ConnectionGroupResponse> callback)
        Remove sub groups from a group

        Target API Endpoint: /consumer/connection/group/removeSubGroup

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          the account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required, deviceId added automatically)
        • SirqulKeys.groupId
          the parent group id
        • SirqulKeys.subGroupIds
          list of group IDs to remove from the parent group
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          the current location of the user.

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        ConnectionGroupResponse on a valid response, SirqulResponse on an invalid response
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:

      • requestConnection

        public void requestConnection(Map<String,Object> params,
                     ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
        Sends a friend request to another user and optionally sends a notification.

        Target API Endpoint: /consumer/friend/request

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          the account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required)
        • SirqulKeys.friendAccountId
          the friend's account id
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          the application key for the app. Maps to "gameType".
        • SirqulKeys.notificationMessage
          optional message to send in a notification

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.

      • searchConnectionsByName

        public void searchConnectionsByName(Map<String,Object> params,
                           ISirqulCallback<ConnectionListResponse> callback)
        Search for accounts that the user may not have a connection with.

        Target API Endpoint: /connection/search

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          the account id
        • SirqulKeys.keyword
          an optional keyword to search on, this parameter is ignored if empty
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          the current location of the user
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          the application key. Maps to "gameType".
        • SirqulKeys.start
          the start index for pagination
        • SirqulKeys.limit
          the limit for pagination

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a ConnectionListResponse on valid response, or SirqulResponse with error message
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
